prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector as [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Now, create the 2D sketch for this part, which will be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 1. Sketch face_1: Create a loop_1 on this face, which contains the following curves: a. line_1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] End Point: [0.5, 0.0] b. line_2: Start Point: [0.5, 0.0] End Point: [0.5, 0.25] c. line_3: Start Point: [0.5, 0.25] End Point: [0.2551, 0.5] d. line_4: Start Point: [0.2551, 0.5] End Point: [0.0, 0.2603] e. line_5: Start Point: [0.0, 0.2603] End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Since the prism has parallel and perpendicular faces, properly apply the necessary constraints to loop_1, such as making it a closed loop and aligning the lines according to right angles. Now you have created the 2D sketch. Scale this sketch by a factor of 0.5 using "sketch_scale" scaling parameter. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. The final step is to extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Extrude the sketch with the following properties: - "extrude_depth_towards_normal": 0.75 - "extrude_depth_opposite_normal": 0.0 Please note that there will be no penetration of materials between this part and the potential preceding CAD models. It results in the creation of a new solid body. height: 0.5 width: 0.75 length: 2</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.25],"End Point":[0.2551,0.5]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.2551,0.5],"End Point":[0.0,0.2603]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.2603],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.5,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. *Face 1:* * Loop 1: + Line 1: Create a line with a start point at [0.0, 0.0168] and an end point at [0.1753, 0.0168]. + Line 2: Create a line with a start point at [0.1753, 0.0168] and an end point at [0.1753, 0.548]. + Line 3: Create a line with a start point at [0.1753, 0.548] and an end point at [0.0, 0.548]. + Line 4: Create a line with a start point at [0.0, 0.548] and an end point at [0.0, 0.0168]. * Loop 2: + Circle 1: Create a circle with a center at [0.0641, 0.5076] and a radius of 0.0319. *Face 2:* * Loop 1: + Circle 1: Create a circle with a center at [0.3681, 0.2584] and a radius of 0.0319. *Face 3:* * Loop 1: + Line 1: Create a line with a start point at [0.5747, 0.0] and an end point at [0.75, 0.0]. + Line 2: Create a line with a start point at [0.75, 0.0] and an end point at [0.75, 0.5312]. + Line 3: Create a line with a start point at [0.75, 0.5312] and an end point at [0.5747, 0.5312]. + Line 4: Create a line with a start point at [0.5747, 0.5312] and an end point at [0.5747, 0.0]. * Loop 2: + Circle 1: Create a circle with a center at [0.6554, 0.4877] and a radius of 0.0319. After creating the sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0797 towards the normal, no extrusion in the opposite direction, and a sketch scale of 0.75. The operation for this part is to create a new solid body. The dimensions of this part are as follows: * Length: 0.75 m * Width: 0.75 m * Height: 0.08 m</description>

<description>Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to (0, 0, 0) and the translation vector to (0, 0, 0.375). Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle using the center point at (0.375, 0.375) with a radius of 0.375 units. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75, applied uniformly to the entire sketch. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Define the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and the translation vector (0, 0, 0.375) for the 3D transformation. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.1875 units towards the normal and to a depth of 0.1875 units in the opposite direction of the normals, creating a slightly tapered top. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Set the euler angles to (0, 0, -90) and the translation vector to (0, 0.375, 0). Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the Y-Z plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle using the center point at (0.375, 0.375) with a radius of 0.375 units. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75, applied uniformly to the entire sketch. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Define the euler angles (0, 0, -90) and the translation vector (0.375, 0, 0) for the 3D transformation. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.1875 units towards the normal and to a depth of 0.1875 units in the opposite direction of the normals, creating a flat bottom. Part 3: Construct a prismatic object with a flat top and bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Set the euler angles to (-90, 0, -90) and the translation vector to (0.375, 0, 0). Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Z plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle using the center point at (0.375, 0.375) with a radius of 0.375 units. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75, applied uniformly to the entire sketch. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Define the euler angles (-90, 0, -90) and the translation vector (0.375, 0, 0) for the 3D transformation. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.1875 units towards the normal and to a depth of 0.1875 units in the opposite direction of the normals, creating a prismatic object with a flat top and bottom. Final Shape: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom The final shape is formed by the intersection of part 1, part 2 and part 3. The front and back faces are parallel to each other, while the side faces are perpendicular to both the top and bottom faces. The object is centered in the image, with a length of 0.75, a width of 0.75, and a height of 0.375 units.</description>
